result.execSummary:
The defendant Brett T. Standke was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: In the event probation is revoked, Defendant would be entitled to Good Time Credit and Huber Privileges.

miscConds.notes: Bond previously posted in the amount of $150 has been applied. Remaining costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. No contact with A. or M.A. Piechowski directly or indirectly. No phone calls, e-mails, text messages, written communications or by third party.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brett T. Standke

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Case called @ 3:03 p.m. Defendant Brett T. Standke in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defendant advised of right to counsel and expertise.  Voluntary waiver of counsel accepted by Court.  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. Plea: NC. Repeater enhancer DRI. Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Statement by DA Blader on behalf of the victim. No statement by DE. Court orders: 90 days WCJ - Huber, GT, No CFTS - I/S - 1 year probation - Conditions: AODA and follow through, defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician, NC w/ A. or M. A. Piechowski, costs w/ 60 DTP or PP. Bond previously posted to be applied. Appeal rights given.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 8, 2016 at 02:45 pm.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Defendant Brett T. Standke in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is requesting a plea/sentencing hearing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 8, 2016 at 02:45 pm.

Pre-trial conference at 02-17-2016 10:15 am.
Status conference at 03-08-2016 01:15 pm.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

Case Called @ 2:04 PM:  Defendant Brett T. Standke in court, appearing pro se.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Repeater allegation explained to Defendant.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel.  Defendant does not wish to have counsel today.  NGP received and entered.  Def requests to speak with the DA on his own without counsel.  ADA argues for $150 cash bond w/conditions.  No objection by Def.  PTC/STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 17, 2016 at 10:15 am.  Status conference scheduled for March 8, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
